Exaggerate: The claim may be seen as an exaggeration because it states that all of the emails have been released, which may not be entirely accurate.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide evidence or specific details to back up the assertion that all emails have been released.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that all emails have been released based on the statement of the person involved, without independent verification or confirmation.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times because it contradicts the fact that some emails were classified, including "top secret" ones.
Exist alternative explanation: An alternative explanation could be that not all emails have been released, despite the assertion made in the claim.
